result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Heintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 2 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended apply as to Conditions for Probation if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Shopko Pharmacy and Dr. S.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - with all Standard Release Conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber by 07:00 p.m. on 08-14-2015.
LAST 4 MONTHS STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.

Amendment to the Judgment of Conviction:  Approved and Signed by the Court on 05-10-2016.  Impose 45 days out of the 4 months available on the court order, of Condition Time with Huber (release for work and treatment) in the Waukesha County Jail as a sanction.
dated 5/6/16 filed by DOC with fax cover sheet requesting 45 days condition time as a sanction, with proposed Amendment to Judgement of Conviction.

filed by defendant's father-in-law in regards to his huber sentence.

8/27/15 Court is taking no action on Frank Richter's letter regarding release for huber. Court clerk notified Mr. Richter by telephone of Judge's response.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katina Seipel  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Anthony L Heintz in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's father in law presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
2  Days Credit.  
STAYED. 

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Shopko Pharmacy and Dr. Schallue.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
8 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to Huber by 7:00 p.m. on:  08/14/15.
Last 4 Months - STAYED - To be used at the agent's discretion.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
